{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3153703,"name":"Tom Corrigan","username":"tcorrigan5878","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/779978/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T16:28:55.036Z","cooked":"

We are burning the CAN ID onto each of our SparkMax’s but they don’t seem to be retaining them. Running the Robot code we get an error message listing the CAN IDs for drive controllers saying that the version info for them cannot be retrieved. At a loss as to what is happening.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-27T16:28:55.036Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":536,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":2706.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428305,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-doesnt-appear-to-be-retaining-can-ids","display_username":"Tom Corrigan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/spark-max-error/428368/4","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Spark Max Error","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-doesnt-appear-to-be-retaining-can-ids/428305/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3153823,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T18:25:57.181Z","cooked":"

What do you see in the REV Hardware Client?

There’s an issue with SPARK MAX where if they are connected (via CAN) and you start out with more than a single motor controller with the same CAN ID, changing that CAN ID will most likely change all of the ones that started with identical CAN IDs.

If this is happening, you can disconnect CAN and use USB-C at each motor controller to get around this issue.

REV Hardware Client CANid setting requires that they not be electrically connected to the CANbus but still have 12v applied while the CANid is being set, and the button to make the id “stick” is not intuitively labeled to me (its down at the bottom of the Hardware Client page).

(We also needed to recovery-mode one SparkMax in this process)

Are you saving the configuration to memory? When I was assigning CAN ids, I forgot to burn the flash, and it reset the next time I power-cycled it.
